A huge battle fought at Perryville and another yesterday many killed on both sides - I went down street to day and did some shopping - Mr & Mrs Ely called to see us to night - Mr Badger gone to church meeting - baby a great deal better Belle also well - 
Tuesday Oct 14
Mr Hunt arrived this morning - we all well to day - I am making children red & white ? dresses - I went out to day in my new drab? hat -Mr Hunt came to see us Mr Badger is gone to the Hotel with him - received a letter from Pa - Mrs Beidmond? & daughter called
Wednesday Oct 15 - 1862
It is a beautiful day - Ella Badger came and took Belle Eva & Ada to her house to spend the day - I went visiting called on Mrs S. A. Smith - Le. Laflin Mrs Gusnee Mrs Walker & Mrs Miller Mrs L. L Hayes Mrs Moulten Mrs B. F Haddock Mrs Adams Allen & Mrs Dreffield then I got Mr Badger and boy Sheridan and went to the West end for children - returned home late - at nine O'clock there was a large torch procession to meet the Bishop Dregan - who has just returned from Ensape? - they played beautiful music he made some remarks - 
Thursday Oct 16 - 
More lovely weather - we all well - children gone down town - Mary Lyons came to see them - to night they have gone to see Clara Wheelas? Mr Badger gone to the Meeting of the Ministry at Sarge - I wrote to Pa - Mr Hunt took dinner with us -

[At top of page above header   Calls 17   baby 2 upper teeth]
Friday Oct 17, 1862
It is beautiful to day.  I went visiting all day - called on Mrs Willard  Mrs T. M Walker - Mrs F. Y Adams  Mrs Leonard  Mrs Byford  Miss McCabe  Miss Stewart    after Tea I called to see Mrs Flint & Misses Clarks   On returning I lost my new onyx sleeve button.  Mr. Badger is out.
Saturday Friday crossed out Oct 18
It is lovely to day.  I do not feel well.  I will write to sister Belle.   Mrs Badger gone to see Mr Hunt.  Sunday they will leave for New York.  Belle & Eva gone down street
Sunday Oct 19, 1862
It is again lovely weather    all gone to Church but me.    Mr Hunt dined with me - Mr Badger and children gone to their Grandpa Badgers   Brackett Badger arrived today from New York.     John Hilton came from Louisville.  I wrote to Pa.     Walter Hilton Brackett & Albert Badger all came to see us.  Mr Badger and Mr Hunt left at 7 Oclock to night.  Mr. Badger felt badly about leaving us.
Monday Oct. 20
This is again a beautiful day.  all well but me - Brackett Badger is staying with us on a visit.   children have gone to invite some friends of ours to the club.
Tuesday Oct 21st
More charming weather.  I feel a little better.   have invited about 30 besides our club.   I have finished childrens tartelons    will write to morrow to Mr. Badger -  baby has 2 upper teeth.
Wednesday Oct 22nd
It is still charming weather.  I got a hack and took all the children out inviting friends.   I wrote to Mr Badger   I was invited to go to the Theatre to night by Octave & Brackett
Thursday Oct 23rd
We are quite busy to day arranging for Club to night of the Grass hoppers.  Brackett Badger gave me a handsome vase to hold the grape tree - it was fixed very pretty with grapes tied on      at nine the company began to assemble - many were in full dress - all looked well.   about 150 persons were here - we had good music - children all looked well - and danced well.  Sheridan danced the Polka and was very much applauded.    about 12 O.clock Leiutennant Cook and Mr. Bird came with the Government band the 16 Illinois regimental.   they played beautiful Music - we invited all into supper.   there was many in the band -  after they eat they went into the Vestibule and played more      twice they played Dixie for me - the Leiutennant said he would have them play all night if I said so - I wish he had been in earnest.    the company left at 3 Oclock - all seemed to enjoy themselves.   it was a brilliant crowd - I wish Mr Badger had been here  - some sent regrets -  we all well - it rained slightly

[Written at top above header   visits 29-Oct &30th   Rebekah $4.00   /  24th Louisa 21-24    hannah away Saturday & Monday]
Friday Oct 24th
I rose to nine Oclock breakast - Ella Badger stayed all night   she and Belle did not get up untill 2 Oclock.  Eva and other children at ten    all very tired    I wrote to Virginia to day - received a letter from David.
Saturday Oct 25
It is very cold to day and is snowing fast.  Ella went home after Tea   Walter Hilton Albert Badger Brackett & Octave all came and played cards with me - received a letter from Mr Badger - all well
Sunday Oct 26
the snow is on the ground and walking is very bad - I went to church with Belle & Eva -  after dinner went to Father Badgers   returned at nine.   boys all came home to tea? with us - Octave Brackett Albert Walter and Mr Gennett
Monday Oct 27 - 1862
I went shopping to day with Belle & Eva.   did not return untill after dark -  after tea went with Walter and Octave and called on Miss Waller and Miss Stewart.  Hannah did not come -  snow all gone
Tuesday Oct 28
A beautiful day.    went shopping    wrote to Ma    Rebekah had a tooth pulled - all well - Hannah came    I gave five dollars to the fair for the Friendless    boys gone to Miss unclear   Belle & Eva went out to Grandpa's
Wednesday Oct 29
It is a lovely day -  I took a hack and made calls  -  I called on Mrs Robb - Mrs Turemone  Mrs Dr Parker - Forsythe  Mrs Price  Mrs Rogers Ontario street -  Mrs Goodwin  Mrs Leduc  Mrs Dr. Johnson  Mrs Wm Waller  Rev Clarkson  Mrs Dester -   the Bishop called on me Bishop Dugan (Catholic)    Clara Wheeler called to see me - children gone to Walkers
Thursday Oct 30th
This is a beautiful day.   Mrs & Miss Warner called -  Ms Flint -  Mrs & Miss Foster -  Mrs Wheeler  Mrs S. A Smith -    after Ten young Wheeler called   so did Miss Ward & her Brother.   Brackett taken Belle Eva & Ada to the Fair   I received a letter from Lill?      last night at eight I heard some one cry murder - near our house -    it proved to be a Gentleman who left the Clifton house and reached the Corner of Madison & Michigan when he was seized by two men and choked & beat and they attempted to rob him - but did not succeed - some one came to his assistance.
Friday Oct 31st
This has been a splendid day -  we all very well -    I sent for a hack and went visiting -  bought a new white shawl - also children Plush Cloaks     I called on Mrs Vandervogt  Mrs Porter  Mrs Caulfeld  Mrs M. B. Farlin - Mrs Whitney Farlin  Mrs B. F. Sherman  Mrs Hunt  Mrs Seaverns  Mrs Duncan  Mrs Endicott  Mrs Morris       M. O. Walker Gilman  Mrs Farnham  - children went to see Duffields - Bella Gurnee?  came to see Ada -  it is lovely Indian Summer

[Above header bar}   School Nov 5]
Saturday Nov 1st 1862
Again we have lovely weather -  children all took their bath - we all well    last night at 12 OClock - the Government band #16 - gave me another serenade.  I went shopping to day took Ada & Sheridan with me -  it turned cool and Ada took cold.   I gave Hannah a Collar.
Sunday Nov 2nd 1862
It rained this morning so we could not go to the depot.   but Wm Badger came at nine - quite well - he brought us many pretty present  me a handsome moire Antique and a black silk dress  --  a steel shawl pin and 2 buckles -  pictures for Album.  Ada and Album    Sheridan a leather hat and children pictures and fine pears  - baby a pretty powder box   many other small things he brought    after dinner we went to Father Badgers -  Mr Badger went to church.
Monday Nov 3rd
Received a letter from home  - we all well -  Sister Lavinia & Ellen took dinner with us -  I went down street and did some shipping -  after Ten Mr Badger and I went to see Rev Thomas & wife - children all gone to Father Badgers -  Misses Hearmons called
Tuesday Nov 4th
Fine weatther   we all well  -  Mr Badger gone to Porkhouse with John Hilton - Brackett Badger went away to Joliet to night -  after dinner I went shopping  -  Miss Stewart came to see me -- after Ten Mr David Henly called to see me --
Wednesday Nov 5th
It is a little cold to day -- we all well -- it is raining after breakfast   Mr Badger and I went with Belle & Eva to take them to school.   they much delighted   they begin to the Dearborn Seminary  -  they have  many pupils - a large building -- at 8 Oclock Mr Badger and I went to Mrs Flints to the sewing society - we spent a very pleasant evening - we danced
Thursday Nov 6th
It is my reception day -  Mrs Butler  Miss Butler & Mrs Turnly came to see me -  we are having our piano fixed -  it snowed very much at 4 Oclock.   Mr Badger bought leather gloves and a fine robe for a sleigh -   children have gone out to uy books  -  I am making Plush cloaks for children
Friday Nov 7
beautiful day   Aunt Harriet and Ella spent day and night with me   we went after Tea with children to the Fair   for the home of the Friendless  -- had a leasant evening  - Octave took me and Mr Badger  Aunt Harriet.

Sunday Nov 9th
It is beautiful to day.  I am quite well - so is all our family.   Mr Badger gone to west end to the Universalist Sunday school -  children to Unitarian  and I intend to go with Wheelers to Grace Church after donner   I went with Ada & Sheridan to Father Badgers to say Good Bye to Aunt Wendell who leaves for Block Island in the morning
Monday Nov 10th
It looks like rain to day.   I went down town with Sheridan shopping  returned at four O.clock.   made preparations for the Nite? Party --   at nine Mr Badger & I went   -  there were many there -- has a fine band of music  -  I danced every sett.   No supper -  it is not allwed by the club.  every one put into a baskett something for the sick soldiers -  we returned at 12 O.Clock -
Tuesday Nov 11th 1862
It has been raining all day.   children went to school  -  we received an invitation to Miss Butler's party thrusday night   Hannah not well to day -
Wednesday Nov 12th 1862
I went shopping with Ada to day  - we all quite well -  Mrs & Miss Whitehouse called -
Thursday Nov 13th
This is my reception day - Miss Flint called  Mrs Moulten  Mrs Wilson & Miss Wilson  Mrs. Luduc  Mrs King & Mrs Whitney Parkin -- Miss Brown called to invite us to Tea.     we went to Dr Butlers party and had a pleasant evening - a great crowd and fine supper
Friday Nov 14
It is cold but clear - I went out all day  -  making children yellow Merinos with white fold braided in black.  Mary Willard invited children to her house to morrow -  Mrs Hobson making children white velvet hats -  we all well - received a letter from David -  children gone to Walkers
Saturday Nov 15th 1862 
This is an ugly boisterous day  -  wind very high  -  children gone to Williards to tea  -  I walked out   saw many friends   Capt Brownax? came home with me - had a nice time - children invited to a party Monday at Beechers.  Mr Badger gone for children.  received letters from home - 
Sunday Nov 16 1862
It rains to day - yet all are going to church - children wore their new white velvet Hats and black plush cloaks trimmed with brass buttons  I wrote home to Pa and Sister Horace took dinner with us.
Monday Nov 17
I went shopping to day   Sister Licinia Hilton came her with her three chldren - Hutchings Alice and Florence -  they went to Beechers party with Belle Eva & Ada - they stayed all night.

Tuesday November 18th 1862
It is still Raining children gone to school - Sister Licinia & Alice Florence and Ella all spent the day with me - after dinner we all went shopping - Brackett arrived to day - Hilton children stayed all night with us again - we had a dance after Tea.
Wednesday November 19
It is cloudy to day and cold, nurse Ellen gone down town and I nursing - making children black spencers trimmed with red - also finishing their yellow merino's trimmed with white gold merino braided in black - Hiltons children gone home at four - Mrs Redmond & daughter called to see me - I received letters from home - Belle & Eva had the dress maker to fit them to day - first time in their lives   I make their dresses usually -   I went down town and ordered a head dress for Licinia
Thursday Nov 20th 
It snowed very fast this morning - but soon melted   Ada & Sheridan out in it  -  with Nancy it has continued bad all day - Mr Alcott called to see me - at 9 oclock we went out to Judge Green's to a  party - or our our Grasshopper club   - returned at two   Ada complained of her head where she fell and hurt
Friday Nov 21st
It is fine weather to day - Mrs S. S. Hayes called to see me - I went visiting called on Mrs Feild of New York   Mrs Wilson  Mrs Hadduck - Mrs Childer - Mrs Johnson of New York   Mrs Bentley   Mrs Tyler & Duffield -  Mrs Duffield has her daughter Alice sick with Typhoid Fever -  Mrs Gurnee & Miss Delia came to see me after Tea  Mrs Haley came to see us   so did Mr Bigelow - we all played cards until late   received the Greene's wedding cards - she married Mr Belt 
Saturday Nov 22nd
It looks like rain - we all well - at one O. clock I took a hack and went to Mrs Herfoots with Belle Eva & Brackett    the Duffield children came to see me - children gone to see Nellie Clyde 
Sunday Nov 23rd 
It has been a lovely day - I went to church with Mr Badger Belle Eva and Brackett - the family all went to Father Badgers but me - after Tea we all went to Unitarian Church - to the meeting of several schools - many pretty addresses  - Mr Bigelow came home with us 
Monday Nov 24th
It looks like rain - I went shopping all day - at nine O'clock I went with Mr Badger and Brackett to Mrs Millers party in behalf of Soldiers Aid Society   enjoyed myself much - danced a great deal - round dances and all - came home at 12
Tuesday Nov 25th
It threatened to snow - I went to the Funeral of Mr Walkers brother   he fell dead - was fifty two years old - was brought here to the City for interment - they live next door to us - we all well  -

Wednesday Nov 26th 1862
Received a letter from Sis - they all well -  making children cloth drab travelling dresses - hats and dresses trimmed with sky blue -  felt hats square crown - vrey pretty trimmed in blue velvet -  this is the day for Sue Greene's wedding - at 3 O.clock.   I went down town shopping and at three I went to Bishop Whitehouse's church (Episcopal Minister) - the church was crowded - but they gave us the front seat  -  I took Belle Eva Ada Cousin Brackett and myself - the whole ceremony passed off finely   six Bridesmaids and Groomsmen very handsomely dressed -  the Grooms name was Algernon Sidney Belt - after they were married they returned to Judge Greenes house had had the wedding supper from 4 to 6 Oclock  -  I was urged to remain all evening and about seven Oclock a band of music came and we danced untill eleven -  I sent children home early -  Bridal party return to Cedar Rapids to morrow
Thursday Nov 27 --
This is Thanksgiving day -  I went with Mr Badger and four children  Belle, Eva, Ada & Sheridan to Father Badgers - he had a very delightful day -  it snowed very much all day - we returned at ten O.Clock - Mrs Harrison has a very ill baby -
Friday Nov 28th
children have holiday to day - I took them shopping with me all day -  I received a letter from Sister Belle -  I bought Ada & Sheridan gray Plush cloaks - lso bought Ada a red velvet cloak -  I ordered myself a garnet colored Velet bonnet with a while Plume   Miss Norton visited us to a party at her house on Tuesday night -  A. D Hunt arrived from Louisville to day -  I wrote to Sister Belle to night
Saturday Nov 29 1862
I am busy to day - after breakfast I went down town with Belle & Eva -  the ground full of snow its quite cold.   Mr A. D. Hunt arrived from Louisville yesterday morning.  Eva has bad cold - all the rest well -  Mrs Field called to see me, so did Miss Matilda & Hattie Clark  -- Mr Hunt took tea with us  -  after Tea Mr Seammon & his son Leist Seammons came to see us.
Sunday Nov 30th
This is an ugly day - very sloppy -  Mr Badger gone to Church -  I did not go -  Mr Hunt spent the whole day with us -  Mr Badger was walked tome to Tremont Hotel with him - Eva has Fever with her cold.  Mr Carter Harrison has lost his baby - brain fever - they had a post mortem examination
Monday Dec 1st
It is very cloudy and cold - Miss Agusta Gurnee came to invite Octave to her whist club.  I went shopping all day.  Eva better -  received a letter from home - they all well -  I am making Ada & Shridan plush drab cloaks - little Clarks called to see children

Tuesday Dec. 1st 1862
It is bright but cold  - I went visiting - called on Rutters - Mrs Carver  Mrs Clyde  Mrs Peck & Jones.   invited Miss Brown Miss Walker Misses Gurnee  Miss Ward  Miss Flint  Miss Emerson  Miss Stewart   Miss Waller  Miss Clark  to be with me new years Afternoon  -  sent regret to Hortons party   Mr Hunt  Walter Hilton   Mr Wilson & Mr Hayworth all called to see us   Miss Cunningham and Mrs Gutherie called to see me -  I called to see Mrs Dudley  Miss Cunningham & Mr Sharp -  Sheridan sick to night.  baby too - with cold.
Wednesday Dec 2d 1862
It is a pretty day but cold.  Sheridan very sick -  he had 4 spasms last night and a very strong one at 2.Oclock to day -  we think caused by indigestion.  Belle left school to day - for to prepare for her visit to Louisville.   Mrs Hilton & Ella came to see me -  I am making Ada a red Velvet cloak -  received a letter from home -  Octave sick to day -
Thursday Dec 3 1862
Sheridan very sick today - so is Belle Eva & Ada -  all with Fever headache & sore throat.  Mrs Thomas called to say Good Bye   so did Mrs. and Miss Rogers -  Mr Badger gone tonight to teachers meeting at Chruch.   Ben Adams very ill - I did not go to the Sherman House party to night
Friday Dec 4th
Mrr Badger bought me a very handsome new trunk - children a little better.  I sent for Dr Small.  he says they have influenza   I wrote home -  Mr Hunt took dinner with us           Brackett Badger went to New York to night.  Mrs. Ludington called to invite us to her home Monday night.
Saturday Dec 5th 1862
It looks like snow -  all the children still with influenza   Mr Hunt dined with us.  I went down town and bought Ada white furs & Jamie a gray fur hat.  Mattie a black velvet - Tom a black fur and Mattie Belle a white velvet hat.  Jamie a gray plush cloak  Mattie a black Lyons cloth  -  children invited to a little Tumleys party - 
Sunday Dec 6th
It is cloudy and looks like snow -  children a little better -  Mr Badger gone to church -  we will not get off to night   children not well enough   Father Badger and Ella called to see me - 
Monday Dec 7th 1862
I was busy all day making preparations to leave to night.   children still very unwell.   Belle with severe earache.   at half past six we had a hack and went to the Depot with five children   2 servants  6 trunks and myself.  I Took leave of Mr Badger and Octave and got into the sleeping Car and started without an escort.   we travelled all night safe -- all slept well but Ada.  she had a bad headache and sick stomach.   I sat up with her almost all night.   at five in the morning we arrived at Indianapolis.  all feeling moderately well -

[ Written below header, above diary entry   Gunter 10]
Tuesday Dec 8th 1862
We went into the reception room at Depot and waited there untill eight Oclock.   then got into the Cars and started for Louisville    we arrived at three O'Clock - almost two hours behind time -   David met us in the Omnibus -  he looks very well -   all at the house were very delighted to see us -   I had when I got into the house a raging sick headache -  my Mother had a fine dinner for us.   but I had to go to bed, and in the morning was well again -
Wednesday Dec 9th
This is Sister Virginia & reception day -   the weather is splendid.   like early September -  it is so warm --  Mrs Nast called to see me - so did Emma Tyler and Sister Mrs Bacon -  also Ellen Morris and Mrs Wm Morris  Miss Mary Rawson & Ellen Frye -  all very peased to see us.  Sister Belle and Brother Tom Shreve took tea with us -  Sheridan has a bad spell to night of Indigestion - I had to vomit him -  I sent for Dr Rogers to see Bella  -  he thinks her trouble is rising in the ear - 
Thursday Dec 10th
I went to bed with raging sore throat and cold in my neck from putting on a thin dress.  Mrs Tucker came to see me  so did Mrs Harrison  Mrs Robt Tyler and daughter  Mrs Charles Johnson -  also Mrs Hopkins and Mrs Eaches - also Mrs David -  at four we went out riding   Mr Gunter came and gave Belle & Eva their first music lesson -  Annie Hunt & Lizzie came by to see Belle   Ellen gone out to spend the night with Ellen Tom
Friday Dec. 11th
Still lovely weather --  my throat very sore -  I had fever all night -  baby much distempered with a new tooth.   little Prathers came to see children   Lin spent the day with us -  also Mattie Belle & Tom.  Mr Ben Adams died at nine Oclock of consumption.  Virginia and I went to Mrs Murphy to be fit for Moire Antique dresses.  Belle received a letter from her Pa   she better to day
Saturday Dec 12th
It is raining.   Mrs Hunt came in to see me and had to stay an hour on account of the rain -  all the children are better -  I still have ulcerated sore throat quite bad -  both Sister Virginia & Belle talk of giving our children parties
Sunday Dec 13th
It is sunny and warm but damp - I went to Christ Church with Belle  Eva  Ada  Sheridan - and my sister Faulds? family -  after church we all went to Mrs Ben Adams to see the corpse -  Mr Adams looked very natural.   he was carried to St. Pauls Church had had a very large funeral.  there were at least 40 in the Procession with the family as mourners -  some relations  some friends   Sister Belle spent the evening here -  Belle is not yet well of her severe cold -  I will write to Mr Badger in the morning - I have seen many of my friends.  they all look well --  report tonight says the federal army is whipped badly at Fredricksburg Virginia
